headline.main: COLORADO TURNS TO OPEN THREAT OVER DENVER AIR

docs.lead_paragraph: ''We've tried the easy things,'' an aide to Gov. Dick Lamm said. ''If this doesn't work, we'll have to look at what Governor Lamm calls 'some Draconian measures.' '' If that sounds like a threat, it is intended to be. For on the subject of Denver's pollution problem, Colorado and the Mile High City are running out of time to reduce the country's highest carbon monoxide levels.
